timeline.message:
[freebox] Never log the application token

Automatic update of the thing configuration with the application token

Console command to display the application token

Signed-off-by: Laurent Garnier <lg.hc@free.fr>

Simplified console command in README

Signed-off-by: Laurent Garnier <lg.hc@free.fr>

timeline.body:
Can you use the cached config instead?
```suggestion
        return configuration.appToken;
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Can you use the cached config instead?

Suggested change
return getConfigAs(FreeboxServerConfiguration.class).appToken;
return configuration.appToken;
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: There was no global variable configuration but I added it.
replies.author: lolodomo

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
.asList(new String[] { buildCommandUsage("<bridgeUID> " + APP_TOKEN, "show the application token") });
.asList(buildCommandUsage("<bridgeUID> " + APP_TOKEN, "show the application token"));
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.message:
Review comments considered

Signed-off-by: Laurent Garnier <lg.hc@free.fr>

timeline.bodyHTML:
This better deals with null checks.

Suggested change
if ((thing != null) && (thing.getHandler() != null) && (thing.getHandler() instanceof FreeboxHandler)) {
handler = (FreeboxHandler) thing.getHandler();
}
if(thing != null){
ThingHandler thingHandler = thing.getHandler();
if(thingHandler instanceof FreeboxHandler){
handler = (FreeboxHandler) thingHandler;
}
}
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.message:
Changed way to get the thing handler

Signed-off-by: Laurent Garnier <lg.hc@free.fr>
